metadata.title: CVE-2023-3338 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel's DECnetnetworking protocol. This issue could allow a remote user to crash thesystem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-generic - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-lowlatency - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1111-aws - 5.4.0-1111.120~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1117-azure - 5.4.0-1117.124~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1115-gcp - 5.4.0-1115.124~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1058-ibm - 5.4.0-1058.63~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-oracle - 5.4.0-1110.119~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1095-raspi - 5.4.0-1095.106~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
